definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc

sentences.english: Above term only apply to dorsa above3,000 bales.
sentences.chinese: 以上条件，仅适用于三千捆以上的订单。

sentences.english: He faggoted all the pictures together.
sentences.chinese: 他把所有图画捆在一起。

sentences.english: Then untying the fagot , she gave them the sticks to break one by one.
sentences.chinese: 接着她解了捆，一根一根地给他们折。

sentences.english: All this to say, I didn't feel like I needed to limit my ambitions to Canada.
sentences.chinese: 说来说去，我就不认为自己应该捆在加拿大境内。

sentences.english: Tie the paintbrushes up into bundles and put them away carefully.
sentences.chinese: 把画笔束成捆，然后好好收藏起来。

sentences.english: They looped a rope around the thief.
sentences.chinese: 他们用绳子把那个贼捆了起来。
她被四肢张开地捆在床上。

sentences.english: The two heretics were burned at the stake.
sentences.chinese: 两名异教徒被捆在木桩上烧死了。

sentences.english: The kidneys are structured as a bundle of very fine tubes.
sentences.chinese: 肾脏的结构像紧捆的非常细的管子。

sentences.english: They often tie their long ears back.
sentences.chinese: 她们常常把长耳朵捆在脑后。

sentences.english: Bundles of clothes were strewn all over the floor.
sentences.chinese: 一捆捆衣服丢得满地都是。

sentences.english: She threw the bundle of papers back across the desk.
sentences.chinese: 她把那捆报纸扔回桌子的另一边。

sentences.english: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron
sentences.chinese: 人用脚镣伤他的脚，他被铁链捆拘。

sentences.english: To bind their kings with chains, and their nobles with fetters of iron;
sentences.chinese: 要用链子捆他们的君王，用铁镣锁他们的大臣。

sentences.english: Young men toil at the millstones, boys stagger under heavy loads.
sentences.chinese: 青年人应该服役推磨，幼童倒在柴捆之下。

sentences.english: Help me haul the hay bales into the barn.
sentences.chinese: 帮我把这些干草捆拖到谷仓里。

definition: to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
to suspend/to hang up/to hang a person
a string of 100 cash (arch.)/to lament/to condole with/variant of 吊[diao4]
